meanings.definition: A slight upward or downward slope from the middle to the edges of a road or other surface.
meanings.sent1: The road had a gentle camber to help with water drainage.
meanings.sent2: The bike path had a noticeable camber for easier cycling.
meanings.sent3: The camber of the sidewalk made it fun for skateboarders to ride along.
meanings.sent4: The camber of the hillside created a natural amphitheater for the outdoor concert.
meanings.sent5: The camber of the track made it challenging for the runners to maintain their balance.

meanings.definition: The slightly arched shape of a beam or other structure.
meanings.sent1: The bridge's camber allowed it to bear heavy loads without bending.
meanings.sent2: The camber of the roof helped with rainwater runoff.
meanings.sent3: The camber of the arch gave the building a unique architectural flair.
meanings.sent4: The camber of the support beam resembled a graceful curve in the design.
meanings.sent5: The camber of the tunnel roof provided extra strength to withstand pressure.

meanings.definition: To curve slightly upward or downward.
meanings.sent1: She had to camber the board to navigate the wave smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The skier cambered gracefully down the slope.
meanings.sent3: He cambered his back to stretch after the long drive.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches cambered elegantly towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The road cambered gently, making the drive more scenic.
